text: <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a transcriptional trans - activator of the Human T-cell leukemia virus type I ( HTLV-I ) , induces the expression of many cellular genes through interaction with at least three distinct cellular transcription factors ; CREB / ATF , NF-kappaB , and <extra_id_0> SRF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: This <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of cellular genes is considered to be a critical event in T-cell transformation by HTLV-I .

To elucidate the role of each <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inducible transcriptional pathway in T-cell transformation , we introduced <extra_id_0> Tax1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutants with different trans - activating phenotypes into peripheral blood lymphocytes ( PBL ) by retroviral vectors .

text: Analysis of these PBLs revealed that activation of the NF-kappaB pathway is sufficient to promote the growth response to <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

However , for the clonal expansion of <extra_id_0> CD4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T-cells , which is a characteristic result of HTLV-I infection , activation of the CREB / ATF and <extra_id_0> SRF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> pathways is also required .
